welcomeMessage: Hi **@chauler**, how can I help you?

b.description: Ask Copilot or type / for commands

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:
metadata.helpTextVariablesPrefix: You can also help me understand your question by using the following variables to give me extra context:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview).

b.name: GitHub Copilot

response.value:
Sure, here are some additional issues I found: Snippet with error: `` Location of error: At the start of the HTML document WCAG Guideline violated: 3.1.1 Language of Page Detection Algorithm: Check if the lang attribute in the html tag matches the actual language of the page Explanation of Error: The lang attribute is set to "en" (English), but if the actual content of the page is not in English, this would be misleading for screen readers and other assistive technologies. --- Snippet with error: `

Grocery Store

` Location of error: Inside the `
` tag WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships Detection Algorithm: Check if heading levels are skipped Explanation of Error: The document starts with a level 2 heading, skipping level 1. This can be confusing for screen reader users who rely on headings to understand the structure of the page. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Inside the `` tag in the `` WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value Detection Algorithm: Check if interactive elements have accessible names Explanation of Error: The button does not have an accessible name that describes its purpose. Assistive technologies use this name to help users understand what the button does. --- Snippet with error: `
` Location of error: Inside the `` tag WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships Detection Algorithm: Check if form elements have associated labels Explanation of Error: The label for the password input field is empty and its 'for' attribute does not match the 'id' of any input field. This makes it difficult for screen reader users to understand what input is expected. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Inside the `` tag WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships Detection Algorithm: Check if form elements have associated labels Explanation of Error: The radio button lacks a corresponding label. Each form input should have a descriptive label associated with it. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Inside the `
` tag WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context) Detection Algorithm: Check if the anchor tag is empty Explanation of Error: The anchor tag is empty. It should provide a description of the link's purpose or destination. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Inside the `` tag WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.2 Page Titled Detection Algorithm: Check if the title tag is empty Explanation of Error: The title tag is empty. It should provide a short description of the page's purpose, which helps users find content and orient themselves within it.

followups.message: What are some best practices for improving accessibility in HTML?
